local_clues.quote: squats squats help strengthen your glutes your quadriceps and your hamstrings for a basic squat
local_clues.clue: This statement introduces squats and their benefits, emphasizing the muscles targeted by the exercise.

local_clues.quote: start with your legs just about shoulder width apart lift your arms up in front of you for balance make sure your back is absolutely straight
local_clues.clue: The initial setup for squats is described, highlighting the importance of leg positioning, arm placement, and maintaining a straight back.

global_clues.quote: let's see the squat position from the side

global_clues.quote: your hips and thighs must be parallel to the floor maintaining your form come up to the neutral position

global_clues.quote: while coming up do not lock your knees this puts unnecessary pressure on the joint

logical_inferences.description: Correct Alignment and Avoiding Common Mistakes
logical_inferences.details: This segment focuses on describing the ideal squat position, emphasizing the alignment of the back, knees, and hips. The additional advice against locking knees helps prevent common mistakes, highlighting critical points for maintaining proper squat form.

local_clues.quote: to begin with you can start with three sets with at least 10 reps in the first set 12 reps in the second set and 15 reps in the third set
local_clues.clue: The segment introduces the idea of varying repetitions in different sets at this point.

local_clues.quote: you can always increase the number of sets or the number of
local_clues.clue: Hints that the exercise can be made more challenging over time.

logical_inferences.details: The segment suggests starting with 10 reps, then increasing to 12 and 15 reps in subsequent sets. This implies a structured approach to building endurance and strength while maintaining proper form.

The mention of increasing sets or reps as a person advances suggests a principle of progressive overload, vital for gaining muscles and endurance while doing squats. Proper form is essential to avoid injury.

local_clues.quote: endurance once your stamina increases you can also hold the squat position for a few seconds and do pulses
local_clues.clue: Introduces the concept of holding squat positions and performing pulses as stamina improves.

local_clues.quote: make sure while doing this your form is not compromised
local_clues.clue: Emphasizes that form must be maintained even when performing advanced variations.

global_clues.quote: inhale when you go down and exhale when you come up

logical_inferences.details: This segment likely demonstrates advanced techniques like holding the squat position and doing pulses. Correct form (straight back, proper breathing, and not locking knees) is crucial to avoid injury.

logical_inferences.description: Focus on Form for Safety and Effectiveness
logical_inferences.details: Maintaining form ('do not compromise') during these advanced techniques highlights the importance of correct form for both safety and the exercise's effectiveness. This implies that even as techniques become more challenging, form should never be sacrificed.
